duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide holistic and comprehensive case management and career coaching services to students, including intake assessment, development of short-term and long-term goals, career planning, progress monitoring, and general advocacy.
Conduct job and life skill training, initial student interviews and assessments, and recruitment activities.
Identify barriers to employment, develop action plans for students, and assist in implementing action plans.
Establish partnerships with local businesses, connect students to internship and employment opportunities, and maintain regular contact with students on internship.
Provide advocacy for students facing barriers, engage in general case management, and maintain detailed client records.
Participate in staff meetings, staff training programs, and supervisory sessions, and interact with guests and volunteers with a positive attitude.
Conduct follow-up communications with graduates of the program to ensure their progress.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in Human Services field preferred; A minimum of 2 years case management or social service experience can be substituted for degree
